translation: niekorzystny, przeciwny [having a negative or harmful effect on something]
sentence: The match has been cancelled because of adverse weather conditions.

translation: daleko [from or at a great distance]
sentence: Even from afar the castle was most impressive.

translation: przepaść [a very deep, narrow opening in rock, ice, or the ground]
sentence: They leaned over the rails and peered down into the dizzying chasm below.
A curate is a priest of the lowest rank.
We will always remember our dear departed friends.
We have just received the information about the forthcoming conference.

translation: oszczędny [careful when using money or food, or (of a meal) cheap or small in amount]
sentence: He has always been hard-working and frugal.
The lights of the village were glimmering in the distance.

translation: skłonność [a feeling that you want to do a particular thing, or the fact that you prefer or are more likely to do a particular thing]
sentence: We should be basing our decisions on solid facts, not inclinations and hunches.

translation: leże, matecznik [a place where a wild animal lives, often underground and hidden, or a place where a person hides]
sentence: The tiger returned to its lair, where it snarled from time to time.
Hold your scrotum in the palm of your hand.
His doctor advised him not to do any strenuous exercise.
What you need is some tender loving care.

translation: wyżyna [an area of high land that is not near the coast]
sentence: The whole plateau comprises one vast upland plain.

translation: powołanie [a type of work that you feel you are suited to doing and to which you should give all your time and energy, or the feeling that a type of work suits you in this way]
sentence: Most teachers regard their profession as a vocation, not just a job.
